p.span: regarding how to handle learning at home, limiting screen time, stress management, and more.

h3.div: Please call 630-516-7700 or complete the form below. Please note, staff will be available to take calls during typical business hours of 8am - 4:00pm, Monday - Friday.

div.data-code: Online Form - COVID-19 Questions

span.a: What You Need to Know About Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
What You Need to Know About Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

a.strong: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h3.div: Have Questions for DuPage County Health Department Officials?

div.p: The DuPage County Health Department can be contacted at 630-221-7553 (8am-4:30pm) or after hours at 630-682-7400.

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

p.span: Behavioral Health Support is available from DuPage County Health Department for anyone experiencing emotional distress or in need of support at the Behavioral Crisis Hotline 630-627-1700. The hotline is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-ibL1re purZT-AhqUyc-ibL1re pSzOP-AhqUyc-ibL1re jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

div.p: QUESTIONS? Please contact the district office at 630-516-7700 or fill out the form on this site's home page.
